Class MinimalSpanningTSPHeuristic

  • java.lang.Object
    • MinimalSpanningTSPHeuristic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TSPHeuristic

    public class MinimalSpanningTSPHeuristic
extends java.lang.Object
implements TSPHeuristic
    A TSP heuristic that is seemingly good. Based on an idea dealing with MSTs.

      • computeEstimate

        public int computeEstimate(Point point,
                  CompletedJobSet completedSet,
                  java.util.List<Job> jobs)
        Computes estimate of distance to the goal. Is guaranteed to be admissible.
        Specified by:
        computeEstimate in interface TSPHeuristic
        Parameters:
        point - Our current position.
        completedSet - Data structure containing information on which jobs we have completed.
        jobs - List of all jobs. Includes both completed and incomplete jobs.
        Returns:
        Estimate to the goal state.

      • computeInterjobEstimate

        private int computeInterjobEstimate(Point currentPosition,
                          java.util.List<Job> remainingJobs)
        Estimates the distance needed to travel between all remaining jobs. It considers using each job as the next job to go to, and then do a greedy choice of "how do I get to each [other] job". This is minimised over all first jobs, leading to an admissible heuristic that's pretty damn decent in our tests. Think of it as: "pick next job, then find shortest edges to every other job". Minimising that over all "first jobs", we get an admissible estimate.
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - Current position of the courier.
        remainingJobs - Jobs left to be completed. Must have at least one job.
        Returns:
        An admissible estimate for inter-job travel.

      • getRemainingJobs

        private java.util.List<Job> getRemainingJobs(CompletedJobSet completedSet,
                                   java.util.List<Job> jobs)
        Computes remaining jobs from the given set of remaining jobs.
        Parameters:
        completedSet - Set of completed jobs.
        jobs - All jobs that must be done, including completed jobs.
        Returns:
        List of jobs that are yet to be done.
